column4: nope, just a config file - make a dir, point it at it, startit up, and it should "just work", as long as the config is set correctly
why don't you use the nvidia-settings tool?
i'm using it but it doesn't remember settings, always goes to start
have you tried resetting your config and following the instructions at the website I had ubottu give you?
$ is part of the prompt, not the command
i did this xrandr --output LVDS --mode 1920x1080 is it done now?
I have no idea. different setups will have a different output
that's why I run xrandr by itself to see what it finds
if it did work, the resolution would change - the point behind xrandr is to control the resolution from the commandline - it's not writing to a file
#winehq would be a more appropriate place to ask
